page.title: 09WILDLIFE AT ABBERTON
page.content: Abberton is the major reservoir in Britain for resting and overwintering wildfowl on their migrations to and from breeding grounds in N.W.Europe and in Asia.To protect the unique bird population the area has been designated a Wetland of International Importance under the terms of the Ramsar Convention. The Essex Water Company has hosted a wildfowl ringing station since 1949. Many rings returned from abroad. Some are outstanding, such as a tufted duck on the N.W.frontier of India or a pintail in Senegal, W.Africa. {FISHING} Although bank fishing space is limited due to the steep slopes of the reservoir, Abberton is a noted coarse fishery, famous for its large pike, bream and eels. Day tickets are available.
